If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue  Or walk with Kings nor lose the common touch  If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you  If all men count with you  but none too much  If you can fill the unforgiving minute With sixty seconds' worth of distance run  Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it  And - which is more - you'll be a Man my son!

data.quote: If you would civilize a man  begin with his grandmother.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: To be a man is to feel that one's own stone contributes to building the edifice of the world.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: A sufficient measure of civilization is the influence of good women.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: We think our civilization near its meridian  but we are yet only at the cock-crowing and the morning star.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The path of civilization is paved with tin cans.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Nations  like individuals  live and die  but civilization cannot die.
data.author: Guiseppe Mazzini

data.quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition  a voyage and not a harbor.
data.author: Arnold Toynbee

data.quote: All will come out in the washing.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Wash you  make you clean.
data.author: Isaiah

data.quote: God loveth the clean.
data.author: Koran

data.quote: If dirt was trumps  what hands you would hold!
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Certainly this is a duty  not a sin. "Cleanliness is indeed next to godliness."
data.author: John Wesley

data.quote: If you would lift me you must be on a higher ground.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Politics and the pulpit are terms that have little agreement.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: As a career  the business of an orthodox preacher is about as successful as that of a celluloid dog chasing an asbestos cat through Hell.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: The life of a conscientious clergyman is not easy. I have always considered a clergyman as the father of a larger family than he is able to maintain. I would rather have chancery suits upon my hands than the cure of souls.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The defects of a preacher are soon spied.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: Cleverness is serviceable for everything  sufficient for nothing.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Be good  sweet maid  and let who will be clever.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: The clothes make the man.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: Whenas in silks my Julia goes  Then  then  methinks  how sweetly flows The liquefaction of her clothes!
data.author: Robert Herrick

data.quote: Costly thy habit as thy purse can buy  But not express'd in fancy  rich  not gaudy  For the apparel oft proclaims the man.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The soul of this man is his clothes.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: She wears her clothes as if they were thrown on her with a pitchfork.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: The ideal committee is one with me as chairman  and two other members in bed with flu.
data.author: Lord Milverton

data.quote: If Moses had been a committee  the Israelites would still be in Egypt.
data.author: J. B. Hughes

data.quote: A committee of one gets things done.
data.author: Joe Ryan

data.quote: A camel is a horse designed by a committee.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If Columbus had had an advisory committee he would probably still be at the dock.
data.author: Justice Arthur Goldberg

data.quote: An institution is the lengthening shadow of one man.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I do not care to belong to a club that accepts people like me as members.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: Those mausoleums of inactive masculinity are places for men who prefer armchairs to women.
data.author: V. S. Pritchett

data.quote: What is a committee? A group of the unwilling  picked from the unfit  to do the unnecessary.
data.author: Richard Harkness

data.quote: No grand idea was ever born in a conference  but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: Life is my college. May I graduate well  and earn some honors!
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: College is the best time of your life. When else are your parents going to spend several thousand dollars a year just for you to go to a strange town and get drunk every night?
data.author: David Wood

data.quote: Those who go to college and never get out are called professors.

data.quote: Colors speak all languages.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Blue is true  Yellow's jealous  Green's forsaken  Red's brazen  White is love  And black is death.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: More pernicious nonsense was never devised by man than treaties of commerce.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Commerce links all mankind in one common brotherhood of mutual dependence and interests.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: Commerce is the equalizer of the wealth of nations.
data.author: William E. Gladstone

data.quote: Whatever has a tendency to promote the civil intercourse of nations by an exchange of benefits is a subject as worthy of philosophy as of politics.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: What distinguishes the majority of men from the few is their ability to act accordingly to their beliefs.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: What a man believes  he will die for. What a man merely thinks  he will change his mind about.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When you have decided what you believe  what you feel must be done  have the courage to stand alone and be counted.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: The eloquent man is he who is no beautiful speaker  but who is inwardly and desperately drunk with a certain belief.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A belief which does not spring from a conviction in the emotions is no belief at all.
data.author: Evelyn Scott

data.quote: Whether you are really right or not doesn't matter  it's the belief that counts.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: Many a man has walked up to the opportunity for which he has long been preparing himself  looked it full in the face  and then begun to get cold feet... when it comes to betting on yourself and your power to do the thing you know you must do or write yourself down a failure  you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.
data.author: Andrew Carnegie

data.quote: Poverty is uncomfortable  as I can testify: but nine times out of ten the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and compelled to sink or swim for himself.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: Anytime you play golf for whatever you've got  that's pressure. I'd like to see H.L. Hunt go out there and play for $3 billion.
data.author: Lee Trevino

data.quote: There is a point at which everything becomes simple and there is no longer any question of choice  because all you have staked will be lost if you look back. Life's point of no return.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Even now we can draw back. But once we cross that little bridge  we must settle things by the sword.
data.author: Julius Caesar

data.quote: You don't know what pressure is until you play for $5 with only $2 in your pocket.
data.author: Lee Trevino

data.quote: The fixed determination to have acquired the warrior soul  to either conquer or perish with honor  is the secret of victory.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: In war there is no substitute for victory.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: Victory at all costs  victory in spite of all terror  victory however long and hard the road may be  for without victory there is no survival.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Better that we should die fighting than be outraged and dishonored. Better to die than to live in slavery.
data.author: Emmeline Pankhurst

data.quote: I sincerely wish war was a pleasanter and easier business than it is  but it does not admit of holidays.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
data.author: General William T. Sherman

data.quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: The worth of every conviction consists precisely in the steadfastness with which it is held.
data.author: Jane Adams

data.quote: The moment one definitely commits oneself  the Providence moves  too. All sorts of things occur to help that would never otherwise have occurred. A stream of events issues from the decision  raising unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance  which no man could have dreamt would have come his way.
data.author: WH. Murray

data.quote: There is no strong performance without a little fanaticism in the performer.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If you don't wake up with something in your stomach every day that makes you think  "I want to make this movie " it'll never get made.
data.author: Sherry Lansing

data.quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. But the tremendous effort needed- one doesn't always want to make it-does one? ... But what else can be done? What's the alternative? What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: I am a stranger to half measures.
data.author: Marita Golden

data.quote: Perform without fail what you resolve.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: To say yes  you have to sweat and roll up your sleeves and plunge both hands into life up to the elbows. It is easy to say no  even if saying no means death.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: What one has  one ought to use  and whatever he does  he should do with all his might.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Nothing's far when one wants to get there.
data.author: Queen Marie of Rumania

data.quote: Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do  do it with thy might.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He that rides his hobby gently must always give way to him that rides his hobby hard.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Stay up and really burn the midnight oil. There are no compromises.
data.author: Leontyne Price

data.quote: Nothing of worthy or weight can be achieved with half a mind  with a faint heart  and with a lame endeavor.
data.author: Isaac Barrow

data.quote: Don't ask me to give in to this body of mine. I can't afford it. Between me and my body there must be a struggle until death.
data.author: Saint Margaret of Cortona

data.quote: Morality  like physical cleanliness  is not acquired once and for all: it can only be kept and renewed by a habit of constant watchfulness and discipline.
data.author: Victoria Ocampo

data.quote: Firmness of purpose is one of the most necessary sinews of character  and one of the best instruments of success. Without it  genius wastes its efforts in a maze of inconsistencies.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: My face is set  my gait is fast  my goal is Heaven  my road is narrow  my way is rough  my companions are few  my guide is reliable  my mission is clear. I cannot be bought  compromised  detoured  lured away  turned back  diluted  or delayed. I will not flinch in the face of sacrifice  hesitate in the presence of adversity  negotiate ... at the table of the enemy  ponder at the pool of popularity  or meander in a maze of mediocrity. I won't give up  shut up  let up  or slow up.
data.author: Robert Moorehead

data.quote: To have no loyalty is to have no dignity  and in the end  no manhood.
data.author: Peter Taylor Forsyth

data.quote: If you are ashamed to stand by your colors  you had better seek another flag.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Great minds have purposes  others have wishes.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: I don't want people who want to dance  I want people who have to dance.
data.author: George Balanchine

data.quote: What a man wants to do he generally can do  if he wants to badly enough.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
data.author: Clementine Paddleford

data.quote: Happy are those who dream dreams and are ready to pay the price to make them come true.
data.author: L. J. Cardinal Suenens

data.quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: One advantage of marriage  it seems to me  is that when you fall out of love with him  or he falls out of love with you  it keeps you together until you maybe fall in love again.
data.author: Judith Viorst

data.quote: You can't try to do things  you simply must do them.
data.author: Ray Bradbury

data.quote: I am in earnest  I will not equivocate  I will not excuse  I will not retreat a single inch  and I will be heard.
data.author: William Lloyd Garrison

data.quote: If you don't make a total commitment to whatever you're doing  then you start looking to bail out the first time the boat starts leaking. It's tough enough getting that boat to shore with everybody rowing  let alone when a guy stands up and starts putting his life jacket on.
data.author: Lou Holtz

data.quote: When I stand before God at the end of my life  I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left  and could say  "I used everything you gave me."
data.author: Erma Bombeck

data.quote: It seems safe to say that significant discovery  really creative thinking  does not occur with regard to problems about which the thinker is lukewarm.
data.author: Mary Henle

data.quote: If a man hasn't discovered something that he will die for  he isn't fit to live.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Moderation in war is imbecility.
data.author: Admiral John Fisher

data.quote: Let my name stand among those who are willing to bear ridicule and reproach for the truth's sake  and so earn some right to rejoice when the victory is won.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. You must be able to sustain yourself against staggering blows. There is no code of conduct to help beginners. That is why some people with mediocre talent  but with great inner drive  go much further than people with vastly superior talent.
data.author: Sophia Loren

data.quote: The wonderful thing about saints is that they were human. They lost their tempers  got hungry  scolded God  were egotistical or impatient in their turns  made mistakes and regretted them. Still they went on doggedly blundering toward heaven.
data.author: Phyllis McGinley

data.quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times  always with the same person.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: Winners are men who have dedicated their whole lives to winning.
data.author: Woody Hayes

data.quote: Those who love a cause are those who love the life which has to be led in order to serve it.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty  you cannot find unity and peace in your active living.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than zeal. The winner is he who gives himself to his work body and soul.
data.author: Charles Buxton

data.quote: Now I am steel-set: I follow the call to the clear radiance and glow of the heights.
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: Love me  please  I love you  I can bear to be your friend. So ask of me anything ... I am not a tentative person. Whatever I do  I give up my whole self to it.
data.author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

data.quote: I don't care a damn for your loyal service when you think I am right  when I really want it most is when you think I am wrong.
data.author: General Sir John Monash

data.quote: One's lifework  I have learned  grows with the working and the living. Do it as if your life depended on it  and first thing you know  you'll have made a life out of it. A good life  too
data.author: Theresa Helburn

data.quote: If you don't stand for something  you'll fall for anything.
data.author: Michael Evans

data.quote: If you deny yourself commitment  what can you do with your life?
data.author: Harvey Fierstein

data.quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
data.author: Cecil B. DeMille

data.quote: Theirs is not to reason why  theirs is but to do or die.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: If you aren't going all the way  why go at all?
data.author: Joe Namath

data.quote: You can be an ordinary athlete by getting away with less than your best. But if you want to be a great  you have to give it all you've got-your everything.
data.author: Duke P. Kahanamoku

data.quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
data.author: Swami Sivananda

data.quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
data.author: General Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: Men  like snails  lose their usefulness when they lose direction and begin to bend.
data.author: Walter Savage Landor

data.quote: It is by losing himself in the objective  in inquiry  creation  and craft  that a man becomes something.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: The height of your accomplishments will equal the depth of your convictions.
data.author: William F. Scolavino

data.quote: The dedicated life is the life worth living.
data.author: Annie Dillard

data.quote: The secret of living is to find a pivot  the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: There's nothing in the middle of the road but yellow stripes and dead armadillos.
data.author: Jim Hightower

data.quote: Standing in the middle of the road is very dangerous  you get knocked down by traffic from both sides.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: He who walks in the middle of the road gets hit from both sides.
data.author: George P. Shultz

data.quote: I never liked the middle ground-the most boring place in the world.
data.author: Louise Nevelson

data.quote: The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who  in a period of moral crisis  maintain their neutrality.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: The man who sees both sides of an issue is very likely on the fence or up a tree.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The middle of the road is where the white line is  and that's the worst place to drive.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: The principle of neutrality ... has increasingly become an obsolete conception  and  except under very special circumstances  it is an immoral and shortsighted conception.
data.author: John Foster Dulles

data.quote: We know what happens to people who stay in the middle of the road. They get run over.
data.author: Aneurin Bevan

data.quote: Show me a person who is not an extremist about some things  who is a "middle-of-the-roader" in everything  and I will show you someone who is insecure.
data.author: G. Aiken Taylor

data.quote: We should not permit tolerance to degenerate into indifference.
data.author: Margaret Chase Smith

data.quote: Most people are not for or against anything  the first object of getting people together is to make them respond somehow  to overcome inertia.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: There is nothing harder than the softness of indifference.
data.author: Juan Montalvo

data.quote: I could not  at any age  be content to take my place by the fireside and simply look on. Life was meant to be lived. Curiosity must be kept alive. One must never  for whatever reason  turn his back on life.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: The accomplice to the crime of corruption is frequently our own indifference.
data.author: Bess Myerson

data.quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils  but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all-the apathy of human beings.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The only difference between a rut and a grave is their dimensions.
data.author: Ellen Glasgow

data.quote: We're swallowed up only when we are willing for it to happen.
data.author: Nathalie Sarraute

data.quote: The only place you can win a football game is on the field. The only place you can lose it is in your heart.
data.author: Darrell Royal

data.quote: I am seeking  I am striving  I am in it with all my heart.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: He did it with all his heart  and prospered.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Wars may be fought with weapons  but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow  and of the man who leads  that gains the victory.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: It was my tongue that swore  my heart is unsworn.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
data.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

data.quote: Nothing can resist a will which will stake even existence upon its fulfillment.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Our future and our fate lie in our wills more than in our hands  for our hands are but the instruments of our wills.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Nothing is so common as unsuccessful men with talent. They lack only determination.
data.author: Charles Swindoll

data.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
data.author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

data.quote: Strength is a matter of the made-up mind.
data.author: John Beecher

data.quote: Your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Common sense is very uncommon.
data.author: Horace Greeley

data.quote: Common sense is in spite of  not the result of  education.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Common sense is instinct  and enough of it is genius.
data.author: H. W. Shaw

data.quote: What is a Communist? One who hath yearnings For equal division of unequal earnings  Idler or bungler  or both  he is willing  To fork out his copper and pocket your shilling.
data.author: Ebenezer Elliott

data.quote: The Communist is a Socialist in a violent hurry.
data.author: G. W. Gough

data.quote: The theory of Communism may be summed up in one sentence: Abolish all private property.
data.author: Karl Marx

data.quote: Communism is the exploitation of the strong by the weak. In communism  inequality springs from placing mediocrity on a level with excellence.
data.author: Proudhon

data.quote: If you want to read about love and marriage you've got to buy two separate books.
data.author: Alan King

data.quote: When you are in love with someone you want to be near him all the time  except when you are out buying things and charging them to him.
data.author: Miss Piggy

data.quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: You don't marry someone you can live with - you marry the person who you cannot live without.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Behind every successful man is a surprised woman!
data.author: Maryon Pearson

data.quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness  a tender look which becomes a habit.
data.author: Peter Ustinov

data.quote: My most brilliant achievement was my ability to be able to persuade my wife to marry me.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades  but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day  ah  now that's a real treat.
data.author: Joanne Woodward

data.quote: Marriage is not a ritual or an end. It is a long  intricate  intimate dance together and nothing matters more than your own sense of balance and your choice of partner.
data.author: Amy Bloom

data.quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other  but in looking outward together in the same direction.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: I married the first man I ever kissed. When I tell this to my children  they just about throw up.
data.author: Barbara Bush

data.quote: Love: Two minds without a single thought.
data.author: Philip Barry

data.quote: Tenderness emerges from the fact that the two persons  longing  as all individuals do  to overcome the separateness and isolation to which we are all heir because we are individuals  can participate in a relationship that  for the moment  is not of two isolated selves but a union.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: I recently read that love is entirely a matter of chemistry. That must be why my wife treats me like toxic waste.
data.author: David Bissonette

data.quote: You can't put a price tag on love  but you can on all its accessories.
data.author: Melanie Clark

data.quote: When you love someone  all your saved-up wishes start coming out.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: No man is truly married until he understands every word his wife is NOT saying.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: "The whole world loves a lover" is an interesting theory  but a very bad legal defense.
data.author: Keith Sullivan

data.quote: I was married by a judge. I should have asked for a jury.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: They say love is blind . . . and marriage is an insritution. Well  I'm nor ready for an instirurion for rhe blind just yet.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: I think men who have a pierced ear are better prepared for marriage. They've experienced pain and boughr jewelry.
data.author: Rita Rudner

data.quote: A woman can forgive a man for the harm he does her . . . but she can never forgive him for the sacrifices he makes on her account.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have  the older she gets  the more interested he is in her.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: So heavy is the chain of wedlock that it needs two to carry it  and sometimes three.
data.author: Alexandre Dumas

data.quote: In olden times sacrifices were made at the altar  a custom which is still continued.
data.author: Helen Rowland

data.quote: Keep your eyes wide open before marriage  half shut afterwards.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: In the race for love  I was scratched.
data.author: Joan Davis

data.quote: Marriage has no guarantees. If that's what you're looking for  go live with a car battery.
data.author: Erma Bombeck

data.quote: To keep the fire burning brightly there's one easy rule: Keep the two logs together  near enough to keep each other warm and far enough apart - about a finger's breadth - for breathing room. Good fire  good marriage  same rule.
data.author: Marnie Reed Crowell

data.quote: Look for a sweet person. Forget rich.
data.author: Estee Lauder

data.quote: Love seems the swiftest but it is the slowest of all growths. No man or woman really knows what perfect love is until they have been married a quarter of a century.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: One of the silliest lines ever said in a feature film came from Love Story  the 1970s hit  which immortalized the phrase  "Love means never having to say you're sorry." There are few people who would actually want to share a life with someone who held that concept near and dear.
data.author: Marge Kennedy

data.quote: Infatuation is when you think he's as sexy as Robert Redford  as smart as Henry Kissinger  as noble as Ralph Nader  as funny as Woody Allen  and as athletic as Jimmy Conners. Love is when you realize that he's as sexy as Woody Allen  as smart as Jimmy Connors  as funny as Ralph Nader  as athletic as Henry Kissinger and nothing like Robert Redford - but you'll take him anyway.
data.author: Judith Viorst

data.quote: Without love  what are we worth? Eighty-nine cents! Eighty-nine cents worth of chemicals walking around lonely.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
data.author: Ben Hecht

data.quote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame  very pretty  often hot and fierce  but still only light and flickering. As love grows older  our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals  deep-burning and unquenchable.

data.quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover  instead of creating the perfect love.
data.author: Tom Robbins

data.quote: Men love because they are afraid of themselves  afraid of the loneliness that lives in them  and need someone in whom they can lose themselves as smoke loses itself in the sky.
data.author: V. F. Calverton

data.quote: When you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody  you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
data.author: Harry Burns

data.quote: [Being in love] is something like poetry. Certainly  you can analyze it and expound its various senses and intentions  but there is always something left over  mysteriously hovering between music and meaning.

data.quote: We are so fond of each other because our ailments are the same.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always.
data.author: Rita Rudner

data.quote: What is there in the vale of life Half so delightful as a wife When Friendship  love and peace combine To stamp the marriage bond divine?
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky  but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: Love is moral even without legal marriage  but marriage is immoral without love.
data.author: Ellen Key

data.quote: A virtuous wife is a man's best treasure.
data.author: Muhammad

data.quote: A wife is the joy of a man's heart.
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: I thought I was in love once  and then later I thought maybe it was just an inner-ear imbalance.

data.quote: When love is strong  a man and a woman can make their bed on a sword's blade. When love grows weak  a bed of 60 cubits is not large enough.

data.quote: Of all the paths [that] lead to a woman's love Pity's the straightest.
data.author: Francis Beaumont

data.quote: To see her is to love her  And love but her forever  For Nature made her what she is  And never made another.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: We have lived and loved together Through many changing years  We have shared each other's gladness  And wept each other's tears.
data.author: Charles Jefferys

data.author: Caroline Rhea

data.quote: I sold my memoirs of my love life to Parker Brothers and they are going to make a game out of it.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: I have learned that only two things are necessary to keep one's wife happy. First  let her think she's having her own way. And second  let her have it.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: Politics doesn't make strange bedfellows - marriage does.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: Someone asked me why women don't gamble as much as men do  and I gave the commonsensical reply that we don't have as much money. That was a true and incomplete answer. In fact  women's total instinct for gambling is satisfied by marriage.

data.quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.
data.author: Henny Youngman

data.quote: I've given my memoirs far more thought than any of my marriages. You can't divorce a book.
data.author: Gloria Swanson

data.quote: Americans  who make more of marrying for love than any other people  also break up more of their marriages  but the figure reflects not so much the failure of love as the determination of people not to live without it.

data.quote: The highest prize in a world of men is the most beautiful woman available on your arm and living there in her heart loyal to you.
data.author: Normal Mailer

data.quote: Love is what makes two people sit in the middle of a bench when there is plenty of room at both ends.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A man loves his sweetheart the most  his wife the best  but his mother the longest.
data.author: Irish proverb

data.quote: No woman ever falls in love with a man unless she has a better opinion of him than he deserves.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: The bravest thing that men do is love women.
data.author: Mort Sahl

data.quote: A woman has to love a bad man once or twice in her life  to be thankful for a good one.
data.author: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

data.quote: Love is passion  obsession  someone you can't live without. If you don't start with that  what are you going to end up with? Fall head over heels. I say find someone you can love like crazy and who'll love you the same way back. And how do you find him? Forget your head and listen to your heart.
data.author: William Parrisb

data.quote: One of the things my life has taught me is how important it is to try to say  "I love you" in ways that can be preserved  looked at  and read when you are alone or when there is adversity or when circumstances bring separation. In any case  . . . saying "I love you" is one of the "secrets" of the happy marriage that Ronnie and I have shared. Ronnie's letters move me to this day. They are his gift to me across the years  and throughout the decades of love.
data.author: Nancy Reagan

data.quote: The most wonderful of all things in life is the discovery of another human being with whom one's relationship has a growing depth  beauty and joy as the years increase. This inner progressiveness of love between two human beings is a most marvelous thing  it cannot be found by looking for it or by passionately wishing for it. It is a sort of divine accident  and the most wonderful of all things in life.
data.author: Hugh Walpole

data.quote: Tell me thy company and I will tell thee what thou art.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Two's a company  three's a crowd.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: We are in the same boat
data.author: Pope Clement

data.quote: The right hands of fellowship.
data.author: Galatians

data.quote: Comparisons are odious.
data.author: Archbishop Boiardo

data.quote: Some say  compared to Bononcini  That Mynheer Handel's but a ninny  Others aver  that he to Handel Is scarcely fit to hold a candle: Strange all this difference should be  'Twixt Tweedle-dum and Tweedle-dee!
data.author: John Byrom

data.quote: The bee and the serpent often sip from the selfsame flower.
data.author: Pietro Metastasio

data.quote: If the poor man cannot always get meat  the rich man cannot always digest it.
data.author: Henry Giles

data.quote: Tis always morning somewhere in the world.
data.author: Richard Hengest Horne

data.quote: Nothing is pure and entire of a piece. All advantages are attended with disadvantages. A universal compensation prevails in all conditions of being and existence.

data.quote: The prickly thorn often bears soft roses.

data.quote: Those who complain most are most to be complained of.

data.quote: The usual fortune of complaint is to excite contempt more than pity.

data.quote: Complaint is the largest tribute Heaven receives.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Compliments are only lies in court clothes.

data.quote: When two people compliment each other with the choice of anything  each of them generally gets that which he likes least.

data.quote: Compliments and flattery oftenest excite my contempt by the pretension they imply  for who is he that assumes to flatter me? To compliment often implies an assumption of superiority in the complimenter. It is  in fact  a subtle detraction.

data.quote: All government - indeed  every human benefit and enjoyment  every virtue and every prudent act - is founded on compromise and barter.

data.quote: Compromise makes a good umbrella  but a poor roof  it is a temporary expedient  often wise in party politics  almost sure to be unwise in statesmanship.

data.quote: Better bend than break.
data.author: Scottish proverb

data.quote: No man was ever so much deceived by another as by himself.
data.author: Charles C. Grevvile

data.quote: The art of making much show with little substance.

data.quote: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The ability to concentrate and to use your time well is everything.
data.author: Lee lacocca

data.quote: It is only when I dally with what I am about  look back and aside  instead of keeping my eyes straight forward  that I feel these cold sinkings of the heart.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: A straight path never leads anywhere except to the objective.

data.author: Isaac Asimov

data.quote: To be able to concentrate for a considerable time is essential to difficult achievement.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.author: Thomas Reid

data.quote: The secret to success in any human endeavor is total concentration.
data.author: Kurt Vonnegut

data.quote: The secret of concentration is the secret of self-discovery. You reach inside yourself to discover your personal resources  and what it takes to match them to the challenge.
data.author: Arnold Palmer

data.quote: Beware of dissipating your powers  strive constantly to concentrate them.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: One arrow does not bring down two birds.
data.author: Turkish proverb

data.quote: No horse gets anywhere until he is harnessed. No steam or gas ever drives anything until it is confined. No Niagara is ever turned into light and power until it is tunneled. No life ever grows great until it is focused  dedicated  disciplined.

data.quote: A man may be so much of everything that he is nothing of everything.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Concentrate your energies  your thoughts and your capital. ... The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.

data.quote: One man  two loves. No good ever comes of that.

data.quote: One cannot both feast and become rich.

data.quote: To do two things at once is to do neither.

data.quote: One thought driven home is better than three left on base.

data.quote: Many people who wonder why they don't amount to more than they do have good stuff in them  and are energetic  persevering  and have ample opportunities. It is all a case of trimming the useless branches and throwing the whole force of power into the development of something that counts.

data.quote: The difference in men does not lie in the size of their hands  nor in the perfection of their bodies  but in this one sublime ability of concentration: to throw the weight with the blow  to live an eternity in an hour.

data.quote: I go at what I am about as if there was nothing else in the world for the time being.

data.quote: Choice of attention  to pay attention to this and ignore that  is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer.

data.quote: Do whatever you do intensely.

data.quote: Other people's interruptions of your work are relatively insignificant compared with the countless times you interrupt yourself.

data.quote: If you direct your whole thought to work itself  none of the things which invade eyes or ears will reach the mind.
data.author: Quintilian

data.quote: Self-conquest is the greatest of victories.

data.quote: There is no pillow so soft as a clear conscience.

data.quote: Thus conscience does make cowards of us all  And thus the native hue of resolution Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought  And enterprises of great pith and moment  With this regard  their currents turn awry  And lose the name of action.

data.quote: The soft whispers of the God in man.

data.quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines. With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. He may as well concern himself with his shadow on the wall. Speak what you think now in hard words and tomorrow speak what tomorrow thinks in hard words again  though it contradict everything you said today.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Consistency requires you to be as ignorant today as you were a year ago.
data.author: Bernard Berenson

data.quote: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.

data.quote: Conservatism is the maintenance of conventions already in force.
data.author: Thorstein Veblen

data.quote: There are those who would misteach us that to stick in a rut is consistency - and a virtue  and that to climb out of the rut is inconsistency - and a vice.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: People who honestly mean to be true  really contradict themselves much more rarely than those who try to be 'consistent'.

data.quote: The only man who can change his mind is the man who's got one.

data.quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
data.author: Horace Smith

data.quote: Shoemaker  stick to your last.

data.quote: Constitutions should consist only of general provisions  the reason is that they must necessarily be permanent  and that they cannot calculate for the possible change of things.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: We are under a Constitution  but the Constitution is what the judges say it is.

data.quote: In questions of power let no more be heard of confidence in man  but bind him down from mischief by the chains of the constitution.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: A good constitution is infinitely better than the best despot.
data.author: Macaulay

data.quote: Enjoy your own life without comparing it with that of another.
data.author: Marquis de Condorcet

data.quote: I earn that I eat  get that I wear  owe no man hate  envy no man's happiness  glad of other men's good  content with my harm.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: He is well paid that is well satisfied.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: It is not for man to rest in absolute contentment.
data.author: Robert Southey

data.quote: No great advance has ever been made in science  politics  or religion  without controversy.
data.author: Lyman Beecher

data.quote: If a cause be good  the most violent attack of its enemies will not injure it so much as an injudicious defense of it by its friends.

data.quote: Conversation is the fine art of mutual consideration and communication about matters of common interest that basically have some human importance.
data.author: Ordway Tead

data.quote: Great talkers are trying to fill the gap between themselves and others  but only widen it.
data.author: Mason Cooley

data.quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.

data.quote: Pollution is nothing but the resources we are not harvesting. We allow them to disperse because we have been ignorant of their value.

data.quote: Speech is civilization itself.

data.quote: The habit of common and continuous speech is a symptom of mental deficiency. It proceeds from not knowing what is going on in other people's minds.

data.quote: The time to stop talking is when the other person nods his head affirmatively but says nothing.

data.quote: There is no such thing as conversation. It is an illusion. There are intersecting monologues. That is all.

data.quote: He was one of those men whose constitutional inability to make small talk forfeits all one's sympathy  and makes one think that social grace is sometimes a moral duty.

data.quote: He (Macaulay) has occasional flashes of silence that make his conversation perfectly delightful.

data.quote: As I got warmed up  and felt perfectly at home in talk  I heard myself boasting  lying  exaggerating. Oh  not deliberately  far from it. It would be unconvivial and dull to stop and arrest the flow of talk  and speak only after carefully considering whether I was telling the truth.
data.author: Bernard Berenson

data.quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Not a sentence or a word is independent of the circumstances under which it is uttered.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: Communication is and should be hell fire and sparks as well as sweetness and light.

data.quote: The really important things are said over cocktails and are never done.
data.author: Peter F. Drucker

data.quote: You never say a word of yourself  dear Lady Grey. You have that dreadful sin of anti-egotism.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing in the right place but to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
data.author: Dorothy Nevill

data.quote: Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
data.author: American Indian proverb

data.quote: People love to talk but hate to listen. Listening is not merely not talking  though even that is beyond most of our powers  it means taking a vigorous  human interest in what is being told us. You can listen like a blank wall or like a splendid auditorium where every sound comes back fuller and richer.
data.author: Alice Duer Miller

data.quote: A man who listens because he has nothing to say can hardly be a source of inspiration. The only listening that counts is that of the talker who alternately absorbs and expresses ideas.

data.quote: When I think over what I have said  I envy dumb people.

data.quote: That is the happiest conversation where there is no competition  no vanity  but a calm quiet interchange of sentiments.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: John Wesley's conversation is good  but he is never at leisure. He is always obliged to go at a certain hour. This is very disagreeable to a man who loves to fold his legs and have his talk out as I do.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: She had lost the art of conversation  but not  unfortunately  the power of speech.

Such a decline in courage is particularly noticeable among the ruling groups and the intellectual elite  causing an impression that the loss of courage extends to the entire society.
